Continuing nominal declines, in the atmosphere of an overall generally up beat market... I wonder if the 'long term aging' aspects of being in the branded whiskeys is showing thru? (Requiring patient warehousing of product before it can be offered for sale, finally getting their money out.)Perhaps the set up of a stand alone division that can take possession of product which will hold while aging, allowing mama MGPI to 'immediately' monetize their output the day they 'sell' to the holding division.(?) Justa thot. (MIGHT be similar to how older brands have been doing their financial accounting for some time already???) Dunno.

MGPI is changing their product mix from unbranded to branded, with both higher SG&A and higher margin. Also there is the sales risk of now competing with the customers who buy unbranded vodka/gin/whiskey/rye. Will long-term customers be forced to find another supplier? Sure MGPI has thought about the risk of trying to have it both ways.I remain a long-term shareholder...who is also concerned about the strategy.
